alert.note: Alert for Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 3:16PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM RELEASE AND SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam release and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Yukon River from Galena to Kaltag * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is occurring along the Yukon River from Galena to Kaltag. Water is overbank into low lying areas along much of the Yukon River. Water may impact fish camps and other remote cabins along the river. In Galena, several roads are inundated with water cutting off parts of the community. Water is surrounding some homes, and sheds and other structures along lakes in the community are impacted by floodwaters. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 300 PM AKDT Wednesday, water from a very large ice jam above Ruby that released on Sunday combined with snowmelt continues to send a surge of water downriver. The large volume of water that was backed up behind this ice jam will take many days to drain so water levels on the Yukon will remain high for a number of days. Water levels continue to recede in Ruby and are cresting in Galena. As the flood crest moves downriver water levels will increase between Koyukuk and Kaltag through at least Thursday, while remaining steady and then very slowly decreasing at Galena. - Flooding is not expected in Kaltag due to the higher elevation above the river. - For Yukon River at Ruby: At 2 pm Wednesday the stage was 32.9 feet. Flood Stage is 40.0 feet. For Yukon River at Galena: At 7 am Wednesday the stage was 125.1 feet. Flood Stage is 124.0 feet. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Yukon between Ruby and Kaltag prepare for minor flooding. Move valuables such as vehicles and boats out of low lying areas and store them on higher ground.

area.areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys
